item.title: C++ - Creating Transparent Dialog
item.description: This is a simple trick to make a transparent dialog without making its child controls transparent. We can set the opacity and transparency color key of a layered window. To know more about layered window you can click here I used SetLayeredWindowAttributes with LWA_COLORKEY to replace a color with transparency, in order to achieve a transparent background. Set the background color of the dialog which is not used in the application.
